fields.description: SVG files are text-based and therefore are able to be versioned like html, xml, etc. Please add this as a possible language for repos.
fields.summary: Add support for repo language: SVG (BB-12550)

fields.description:
Please can you add the option to make a branch only updateable by pull request?

For example I have multiple senior developers with push access to our release branch, some push directly to the branch, but I want them to submit PR's so we can make sure changes are being published in the correct order.
fields.summary: Make branches configurable to be merged by Pull Request only (BB-12561)

fields.description:
I have a snippet with multiple files. I would like to link to the third line of the *second* file. When I click on that line the url updates with a #cl-3 at the end. The screen jumps to the third line of the *first* file. If I share that link, their screen will jump to the third line of the first file.

The line number link should include the file as well as the line number.
fields.summary: Snippet always links to code in first file (BB-12559)

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to minimize files for a number of reasons:

* If you've reviewed it already it's easier to scroll passed big files
* Expecially in .NET, there are often large generated files taht don't need to be reviewed.
fields.summary: Option to collapse/minimise file contents in Pull Request Overview (BB-12555)

fields.description:
I have found that if you reference the same issue in multiple commits and then you do a push of multiple commits, only one commit will be referenced in that particular issue.

Reproduce this way:

Make multiple commits and in the commit message enter "issue #[insert actual issue number]" but do not push them.

Once multiple commits are made and all reference the same issue number PUSH all of those commits.

When you go to look at the issue tracker for that specific issue only one will show in the comments. If you do the same thing but you push the commit as soon as you make it all commits will show up under that issue.
fields.summary: Assigning an issue number in a commit using [ issue #N ]

fields.description: One of my repositories is stuck in cloning phase.
fields.summary: Indefinite Clone

fields.description:
I think there should be a column with a hash function (CRC, SHA, etc) for each file in the Download section of each repository.

In that way we can know whether the files are uploaded and downloaded correctly.

See the screenshot.
fields.summary: Adding a column with a hash function, i.e. SHA-256 to the files in the repository's Download section (BB-12560)

fields.description:
I created a new file via the bitbucket UI in the source page of a repository.

When i copy/pasted the filename, there was an erroneous space at the end of the filename, ie "filename.txt "

It wasn't obvious, git handled the space, but it broke a bunch of stuff and took me ages to work out what was going on.

I suggest somehow making pre or post whitespace obvious in the New File filename dialog, a warning on save, or stripping it out automatically.
fields.summary: Bitbucket New File allows whitespace after filename (BB-12503)

fields.description: If you are looking at a file on source code (on the source tab) and select an old commit, when you switch to the history tab, it'll only show from that commit and older.  It won't let you select from any newer commit than the one you had selected on the source tab.
fields.summary: Looking at source code history (BB-12562)

fields.description:
I noticed that the ticket comments are polluted by 'out-of-office' messages of people.

This can be easily prevented by bitbucket, by adding the appropriate {{Precedence}} header to the automatic emails sent by bitbucket.

h2. example
for example check ticket: https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/5811/support-two-factor-authentication-bb-7016#Shawn Kelly\\
There are quite some  'out-of-office' replies of people recorded in the comment history.

h2. fix
when bitbucket sends automatic mails it should add the {{Precedence: bulk}} or {{Precedence: list}}  email headers. This is recognized by most mailers, and no auto replies (like out-of-office) will be send.
fields.summary: prevent out-of-office replies in bitbucket tickets by using Precedence header in notifications (BB-12556)

fields.description: I have my SSH key set up in Bitbucket and on my local machine, but I consistently get "Permission denied (publickey)" error. I know it is set up as I had it working previously. I know others are having the same issue. I am confident there is something wrong at the bitbucket end.
fields.summary: SSH keys are no longer working

fields.description:
If you name a project "ProJect" the link for cloning will be "git clone ...project.git".\\
This is a wrong behavior, as it should be exactly the same as the name of project, namely "ProJect".
fields.summary: The link for cloning does not contain the same name as the repository

fields.description:
We have set up the Bitbucket - HipChat integration so that we get notifications in a room when a pull request is created. However, Bitbucket will notify the reviewer via email.

We want to implement code review as part of our development workflow, so it would be really great to be able to notify the reviewer via HipChat instead of email.

Email response times are too long - this would be more useful over HipChat.
fields.summary: HipChat notifications for reviewers (BB-12558)

fields.description: Refer to screenshot in attachment.
fields.summary: Unable to Sync Repo Updates

fields.description:
Please help me delete the following repo

https://bitbucket.org/latsolutions/ui-cloudmart\\
https://bitbucket.org/latsolutions/ui-cloudmart-web\\
https://bitbucket.org/latsolutions/ui-fareastiorchid-mobile
fields.summary: This repository is currently unavailable.

fields.description:
Good morning!

I just noticed we're having some trouble with loading all the repositories for our team.

The requested url is https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/{teamname} and we loop over all the paged results.

I can't seem to find any information about any rate limiting on that URI, is there something i'm missing?

The team name is "fbinhouse"

I've found another endpoint for the exact same thing (https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/teams/{teamname}/repositories), is it better to use one or the other?

I've also noticed there seems to be an undocumented "pagelen" var with a limit of 100 you can set, is that something we could use to reduce load or is that something that will disappear?

Thanks for a great service.
fields.summary: Getting "Rate limit for this resource has been exceeded" for team repositories

fields.description:
I would like to be able to directly create an issue from a code comment such that the title or description of that issue gets pre-populated with the text from the comment and possibly a link back to that comment/commit.\\
I saw  BCLOUD-7039 but I would like to have a more clear and visible request for this particular feature.

fields.description:
According to the documentation...

API v1 had a way to

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/pullrequests+Resource+1.0

API v2 apparently only allows getting of comments

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/pullrequests+Resource

I wasn't sure if it was just a documentation difference so I tried it and got a 405 (method not allowed)

Is this intentional?

fields.description:
Hi, I'd like to request a feature, its a bit tricky so here it goes:

I'd like to be able to tag a teammate in the source code and that teammate to get email notification about it, for example:

// @nirc - I need you to add another parameter here so I can get the value\\
or\\
// TODO : @nirc - I need you to add another parameter here so I can get the value

and then when I push the code to bitbucket, it process it, finds the user that matches @nirc and notify it by mail that he was tagged in file X line Y.

I think this might speed development a little..
fields.summary: Tag person in code and get email notifications (BB-12805)

fields.description:
h1. Current Behavior
When editing a file, e.g. the README in a project, using the online editor Bitbucket changes the line endings of the whole file from Unix to DOS (LF to CR+LF). This is really painful, because every single line is then reported as "changed".

h1. Expected Behavior
The online editor should auto-detect the line endings, and save the file in the same format again. The behavior should match the one of typical programmers' IDEs or text editors, such as Eclipse, PyCharm, Notepad++, etc.

Optionally, the online editor could offer an option (drop-down box) to select the intended line-endings for the file being edited. The value preselected in this drop-down box should be the one that the online editor auto-detects.

h1. Additional Information
I had to revert the README file manually using the "dos2unix" command line utility, and commit it again.
fields.summary: Online editor tool changes line endings to CR/LF (BB-12570)

fields.description:
If Account is integrated with a JIRA instance, it would be great if the notification emails from Bitbucket mentioned the JIRA project, or Issue that the repo was associated with somehow.

!2905830992-Capture.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show JIRA Issue, or Project that repo is associated with for email notifications. (BB-12568)
Could not read from remote repository

fields.description: Use case would be to to use the current api (2.0) to pull back a list of specific issues within a specific repo, along with the assigned user for each issue, and the uuid for the user that is assigned to that issue in the repo.  V2 of the API does not pull back a UUID for these users.
fields.summary: Add UUID for users assigned to issues within a repo in API 2.0. (BB-12569)

fields.description: Right now, through the REST API, it's possible to create pull requests from two forks of a primary repository.  For example, if A is the primary and both B and C are forks of A, pull requests can be made between B and C (for instance, to fix up outstanding pull requests or work-in-progress features).  But in the Web UI, this is not available.  It would be awfully nice to be able to do this from the web, too!
fields.summary: Web UI for Pull Requests between forks sharing primary repos (BB-12574)

fields.description:
Issue Description:

I have two repos, tbmsurvey and tbmsurvey.git, the URL for both should be:

https://bitbucket.org/sherlockmao/tbmsurvey\\
https://bitbucket.org/sherlockmao/tbmsurvey.git

But every time I try to go to https://bitbucket.org/sherlockmao/tbmsurvey.git, the page shows the content of https://bitbucket.org/sherlockmao/tbmsurvey.

Not Affected:

In SSH, repo tbmsurvey.git appears like tbmsurvey.git.git and I can pull/push without problem. The dashboard shows the latest update without problem.

By-pass:

I changed the repo tbmsurvey to tbmsurvey-oldhg, then I can visit tbmsurvey.git from web browser now.
fields.summary: Repository Name Shadowing

fields.description:
that verify PKCS#7 signatures, decrypt PKCS#7 data or\\
otherwise parse PKCS#7 structures from untrusted sources are\\
affected. OpenSSL clients and servers are not affected.

This issue affects all current OpenSSL versions: 1.0.2, 1.0.1, 1.0.0\\
and 0.9.8.

OpenSSL 1.0.2 users should upgrade to 1.0.2a\\
OpenSSL 1.0.1 users should upgrade to 1.0.1m.\\
OpenSSL 1.0.0 users should upgrade to 1.0.0r.\\
OpenSSL 0.9.8 users should upgrade to 0.9.8zf.

This issue was reported to OpenSSL on February 16th 2015 by Michal\\
Zalewski (Google) and a fix developed by Emilia Käsper of the OpenSSL\\
development team.
fields.summary: OpenSSL clients and servers are not affected.

fields.description:
existed in previous versions of OpenSSL related teo the\\
processing of base64 encoded data. Any code path that reads base64 data from an\\
untrusted source could be affected (such as the PEM processing routines).\\
Maliciously crafted base 64 data could trigger a segmenation fault or memory\\
corruption. This was addressed in previous versions of OpenSSL but has not been\\
included in any security advisory until now.

This issue affects OpenSSL versions: 1.0.1, 1.0.0 and 0.9.8.

OpenSSL 1.0.1 users should upgrade to 1.0.1h.\\
OpenSSL 1.0.0 users should upgrade to 1.0.0m.\\
OpenSSL 0.9.8 users should upgrade to 0.9.8za.

The fix for this issue can be identified by commits d0666f289a (1.0.1),\\
84fe686173 (1.0.0) and 9febee0272 (0.9.8). This issue was originally reported by\\
Robert Dugal and subsequently by David Ramos
fields.summary: existed in previous versions of OpenSSL related teo the

fields.description:
If client auth is used then a server can seg fault in the event of a DHE\\
ciphersuite being selected and a zero length ClientKeyExchange message being\\
sent by the client. This could be exploited in a DoS attack.

This issue affects OpenSSL version: 1.0.2

OpenSSL 1.0.2 users should upgrade to 1.0.2a.

This issue was discovered and the fix was developed by Matt Caswell of the\\
OpenSSL development team.
fields.summary: then a server can seg fault in the event of a DHE

fields.description:
EC private key file consumed via the d2i_ECPrivateKey function could\\
cause a use after free condition. This, in turn, could cause a double\\
free in several private key parsing functions (such as d2i_PrivateKey\\
or EVP_PKCS82PKEY) and could lead to a DoS attack or memory corruption\\
for applications that receive EC private keys from untrusted\\
sources. This scenario is considered rare.

This issue affects all current OpenSSL versions: 1.0.2, 1.0.1, 1.0.0 and 0.9.8.

OpenSSL 1.0.2 users should upgrade to 1.0.2a\\
OpenSSL 1.0.1 users should upgrade to 1.0.1m.\\
OpenSSL 1.0.0 users should upgrade to 1.0.0r.\\
OpenSSL 0.9.8 users should upgrade to 0.9.8zf.

This issue was discovered by the BoringSSL project and fixed in their commit\\
517073cd4b. The OpenSSL fix was developed by Matt Caswell of the OpenSSL
fields.summary: This scenario is considered rare.

fields.description:
The function X509_to_X509_REQ will crash with a NULL pointer dereference if\\
the certificate key is invalid. This function is rarely used in practice.

This issue affects all current OpenSSL versions: 1.0.2, 1.0.1, 1.0.0\\
and 0.9.8.

OpenSSL 1.0.2 users should upgrade to 1.0.2a\\
OpenSSL 1.0.1 users should upgrade to 1.0.1m.\\
OpenSSL 1.0.0 users should upgrade to 1.0.0r.\\
OpenSSL 0.9.8 users should upgrade to 0.9.8zf.

This issue was discovered by Brian Carpenter and a fix developed by Stephen\\
Henson of the OpenSSL development team.

h1. Note
As per our previous announcements and our Release Strategy\\
(https://www.openssl.org/about/releasestrat.html), support for OpenSSL versions\\
1.0.0 and 0.9.8 will cease on 31st December 2015. No security updates for these\\
releases will be provided after that date. Users of these releases are advised\\
to upgrade.

h1. References
URL for this Security Advisory:\\
https://www.openssl.org/news/secadv_20150319.txt

Note: the online version of the advisory may be updated with additional\\
details over time.

For details of OpenSSL severity classifications-*****
fields.summary: OpenSSL 1.0.2 users should upgrade to 1.0.2a

fields.description:
Apiary.io and the wider Blueprint movement are doing some really great things around API documentation.

It would be great if BitBucket were able to support displaying API Blueprint files in formatted form (ie, rather than in their native markdown).

It would also be nice if you could set a different file (ie, other than readme.md) to be the documentation for your repo - then you could have an API blueprint as your repo documentation if you wanted to.
fields.summary: API Blueprint Support (BB-12573)

fields.description:

Steps to reproduce:

https://bitbucket.org/account/user/dead_eye/ssh-keys/\\
2  Click the add and the "Add SSH key" window pops up.\\
3  Copied key with "cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub | pbcopy"\\
4  Named the key and pasted it into "Key*" and clicked the "Add key" button.

"Invalid SSH key." message appears and the following error appears in the javascript console:

POST https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/users/dead_eye/ssh-keys 400 (BAD REQUEST)\\
(index):5 nrWrapper\\

ssh-keys.js:24 i.onCreate\\
form.js:46 l\\
aui-stable.js:5535 _onclick\\
jquery.js:3058 X.event.dispatch\\

(index):5 nrWrapper

Mac OSX 10.10.2\\

fields.description:
Compare the changes shown at [https://bitbucket.org/Gfy/pyrescene/commits/3473a185f867b74a13ad0c35192249d5#comment-1768278] with the actual raw diff at [https://bitbucket.org/Gfy/pyrescene/commits/3473a185f867b74a13ad0c35192249d5655f237c/raw/]. It looks like some lines have been omitted from the Bitbucket diff. The side-by-side diff is screwed up too.

Looking at the raw diff more closely, with “cat -A” under Linux, shows that most of the file has CRLF line endings ({{^M$}} at the end of the line), but the troublesome lines only have CR line endings ({{^M}} without a line break):

{code}
#!diff
 ^I^Iif not timetuple:^M$
-^I^I^Ireturn "UNKNOWN"^M$
-^I^Ireturn "%04d-%02d-%02d %02d:%02d:%02d" % timetuple^M$
-^I^M$
+^I^I^Ireturn "UNKNOWN"^M^I^Iseconds = timetuple[5]^M^I^Iif int(seconds) != seconds:^M$
+^I^I^I# sub second precision^M^I^I^Ireturn "%04d-%02d-%02d %02d:%02d:%02.7f" % timetuple^M^I^Ielse:^M$
+^I^I^Ireturn "%04d-%02d-%02d %02d:%02d:%02d" % timetuple^M$
+^M$
 ^Idef get_compression_name(self):^M$
{code}
fields.summary: Lines ending with CR only are omitted from web interface diff (BB-13648)

fields.description: If you try to navigate directly to https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/downloads#tag-downloads, you will be redirected to https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/downloads#available-downloads.

fields.description:
In the current form it is very difficult to discuss issues, because one can hardly make clear to which comment an answer refers - as comments do not have numbers.\\
Please display a simple numbering, like googlecode had, for example.

Thanks
fields.summary: Display issue comment number (BB-13564)

fields.description:
h1. Replicate
# Click the Source icon.
# Click any file.

h1. Actual Results
The URL resembles:

https://bitbucket.org/user/project/src/0f35548a...5534445b/filename?at=master

This URL cannot be shared with anyone because as soon as a change is made to the file, the recipients will be viewing outdated information.

The URL can be changed manually so that it always points to the most recent version:

https://bitbucket.org/user/projects/src/master/filename

h1. Expected Results
Please add a button to navigate to the permanent "most recent" master URL that produces a URL that can be shared with others (and won't change if a new version of the file is produced).
fields.summary: Feature Request: Jump to Master URL (BB-12575)

Hi,\\
POST hook doesn't work for cyrillic domains. It would be great if there will be support of such domains\\

fields.description:
I've noticed 2 separate endpoints for v2 API:

* POST https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{owner}/{repo_slug}/pullrequests/
* GET https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/{owner}/{repo_slug}/watchers

Is there a reason there are two endpoints?  Is there a reason to not just pick one?  I've burned a lot of time discovering this...
fields.summary: API Endpoint Ambiguity

fields.description:
Hello,\\
we have just migrated a scientific code to bitbucket and appreciate very much that we can discuss issues using e.g. pictures and input files.

However, it is kind of hard to see which picture comes with which comment, because they are displayed with the BCLOUD-0 reporting comment.

It would be _much better_ if it was _the other way round:_ The BCLOUD-0 comment should have a list of links of all files (if one really wants that), but the file preview/element/object should be displayed with the comment who introduces them.

To us this sounds perfectly reasonable and not so difficult to change - what do you think?

Thanks
fields.summary: Issue attachments should be displayed within the comment which attaches them rather than in the #0

fields.description:
I use [shields.io|https://shields.io/] to display badges in the README of my Open Source projects. Bitbucket seems to have major trouble with them:

* badges from shields.io are not displayed as images (ALT text is displayed, and sometimes the link URL) in the README in the [overview|https://bitbucket.org/bittner/django-organice/overview] and [source file list|https://bitbucket.org/bittner/django-organice/src].
* They do display - kind of - fine in the [file detail|https://bitbucket.org/bittner/django-organice/src/develop/README.rst], though the links don't work then and the text of the file cannot be selected.

Interestingly, the badges display fine on Github, please compare:

* https://bitbucket.org/bittner/django-organice
* https://github.com/bittner/django-organice

It looks like the display problems stem from the shields.io badges being *SVG documents*, not plain images (e.g. PNG). The [W3C validator|http://validator.w3.org/check%3Furi%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbitbucket.org%252Fbittner%252Fdjango-organice%252Foverview%26charset%3D%2528detect%2Bautomatically%2529%26doctype%3DInline%26group%3D0] (click to be taken to the results) displays several violations, this could help you further.

Note that I've opened [issue BCLOUD-395|https://github.com/badges/shields/issues/395] on shield.io's issue tracker on Github. Just in case you feel there's nothing you can do about it.

Tested on Mac OS X 10.10.2 with:

* Firefox 36.0.3
* Chrome 41.0.2272.104
* Safari  8.0.4
fields.summary: shields.io badges (SVG) don't display in README (BB-12563)

fields.description:
I, as well as many others I am sure, would like to utilize Bitbucket Snippets in the form of Embeddable code in HTML.  As of right now, GitHub is the only service that provides Embeddable Snippets (the Gists) that feature the ability to display multiple files simultaneously, that can be updated at any time, and don't need to Execute at any point (Unlike Plunkr)

At this point, these Gists are the only thing keeping my Github account active, I've otherwise migrated entirely to Bitbucket, and I would like to make the full transition with this one missing feature

Thank you
fields.summary: Snippet Embedding
Generic wiki table style leads to scattered reST footnotes (BB-12804)

fields.description: If I want to direct someone to my repo so they can read about it and download binaries, directing them to the main page isn't all that helpful, as the "downloads" button is not very prominent. I think it needs to be more prominent - say, shown in the upper portion of the page near the "clone in SourceTree" button, and labeled "Downloads" or using a more intuitive icon.
fields.summary: Make download repo button more prominent or move to top of ui

fields.description: Laravel is now the most popular PHP framework, it would be great to support Blade syntax highlight when viewing .blade.php file.
fields.summary: Add support of Laravel Blade in syntax highlighter.

fields.description: Cannot scroll inside of a Confluence page while editing it in Chrome browser. The only way to move down a page while editing in Chrome is to use the arrow keys and move the typing cursor -- but that is a clunky make-shift temporary solution.
fields.summary: Cannot Scroll when Editing Confluence Pages in Chrome

fields.description: There is no option to select "AppleScript" as the Language when you create a new repository via the BitBucket website. I'd love to see this added as an option.
fields.summary: Add AppleScript as a language option (BB-12421)

fields.description:
Two enhancements that would make snippets perfect for us, both in the snippets list:

* Filter snippets by language
* Filter snippets by tag
fields.summary: Snippets grouping (BB-12577)

fields.description: I added folder and/or file to a directory but the option to commit do not appear.  Please suggest a solution.  Thanks.
fields.summary: Added folder and/or file to a directory but the option to commit do not appear.

fields.description:
When I click on raw url of a image in my private repo, it redirects to bytebucket.org & append a token so that it can be viewed publicly.These urls look something like this:

https://bytebucket.org/*$username*/$repo/raw/*$sha*/$filename.jpg?token=*$sometoken.*

I figured that these tokens are *unique* for each file. Is there any way I can get/generate this type of token through bitbucket api? Is it possible for Team account with team-api-token?
fields.summary: Add ability to get/generate the token for raw url for a image file in a private repo (BB-13558)

fields.description: See the attachments.
fields.summary: Emoji icons don't appear in email updates (BB-12565)

fields.description:
See http://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria/

Update Bitbucket to be fully accessible for Blind users.

Add Keyboard shortcuts for every possible action.
fields.summary: Update Bitbucket to be fully WAI-ARIA compatible. (BB-13555)

fields.description: I believe we have this in our default languages for repos, let's add it for Snippets, too!
fields.summary: Add 'Swift' as a language for snippets (BB-12422)

fields.description:
When searching for users (eg. adding a user as a reviewer to a pull request), you can currently search by Bitbucket username, display name, and I believe email address. It would be nice to also be able tp search based on their connected accounts (currently Google and GitHub).

The business case is that some organizations have custom Google account domains that are used as their primary login to IT resources. For example, at UW-Madison we have Google accounts that end in @wisc.edu that are only provisioned to staff, faculty, and students. It would be convenient to be able to search by this account.
fields.summary: Search for users by connected account (BB-13543)

fields.description:
Yesterday I started to get messages abort: authorization failed messages for hg push even when the push succeeds. My colleague also had the same experience; this happens on various /rptlab/repos for me replabrobin. Example commands

{code}
#!bat
C:\code\hg-repos\preppy>hg ci -m"remove some space; bump version to 2.3.4"

C:\code\hg-repos\preppy>hg push
pushing to https://bitbucket.org/rptlab/preppy
searching for changes
remote: adding changesets
remote: adding manifests
remote: adding file changes
remote: added 1 changesets with 1 changes to 1 files
abort: authorization failed

C:\code\hg-repos\preppy>hg out
comparing with https://bitbucket.org/rptlab/preppy
searching for changes
no changes found

C:\code\hg-repos\preppy>hg --version
Mercurial Distributed SCM (version 3.3.2)
(see http://mercurial.selenic.com for more information)

Copyright (C) 2005-2014 Matt Mackall and others
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions. There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
{code}

this 'aborted' push is actually [8b905ca.....|https://bitbucket.org/rptlab/preppy/commits/8b905ca9d6d4b137120f7674813ee41354b214f5]

A debug push to /rptlab/reportlab [de929ae....|https://bitbucket.org/rptlab/reportlab/commits/de929aeece0244ac32124083abce07844173e39e] with a slightly older client

{code}

C:\code\hg-repos\reportlab\tests>hg push --debug

fields.description:
Turning a private repo into a public repo is pretty easy - just uncheck a checkbox, hit save, and the repo becomes public. Maybe require the admin to put in the current password or another extra layer of security.

This is related to https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/8363/have-an-admin-switch-to-set-all-account.
fields.summary: Add extra layer of confirmation/security for switching a repo from private to public. (BB-12579)

fields.description:
Hi,

I overlooked commiting my propper gitignore and pushed more than 2gb.\\
Can I reset my repo or that specific commit ?

I use it as a wiki also and would like to keep the work made there.

Thanks in advance
fields.summary: Cannot reset read-only repository

fields.description:
Right now, we only have 'Active' and 'Merged' views available. We should make all branches more visible by showing 'All'.

Another nice update would be to list which branches were open, closed, merged by lozenges.
fields.summary: Create a filter for Branches view: 'All' (BB-12418)

fields.description:
I seem to have stopped receiving push notifications on Repos I'm watching.

The last one I received was 6 days ago.  I've checked my spam, and they're not in there.
fields.summary: Stopped receiving email notifications

fields.description:
The introduction of snippets on Bitbucket is great! It's a really nice implementation, and the team based features are really useful.

It would be really nice to be able to take a public snippet and embed it on a website or blog etc.
fields.summary: Make snippets embeddable (BB-12431)

fields.description: Many users have requested a way to permanently set the tab size at either (or all of) the repository, team, or user level.  This is a follow-on from BCLOUD-6207 which provides a query param for configurable tab size, but isn't sticky (meaning that it needs to be re-applied to each page view and doesn't follow the user through navigation).
fields.summary: Configurable tab size setting

fields.description:
What do you guys think about opening an issue tracker for pull requests?

Imagine going through the code and finding a problem, clicking on the line to add a comment and somehow marking it as an "issue" which would automatically add it as an issue once you add the comment. Additionally, people could just go to PR issue tracker and add an issue manually there.

Just to make it clear, this will not add issues to the repo issue tracker. In this vision, each pull request would have an issue tracker.

I believe this would be very useful.

What do you think?
fields.summary: Pull Request Issue Tracker

fields.description:
This would complement issue BCLOUD-4992 "Add possibility of adding watchers to a ticket (other than one's self) (BB-6234)"

At our company, some _*inexperienced*_ Bitbucket users often watch issues that aren't related to their "tasks" and are asking about the e-mail notifications they are getting.  It would be very convenient for the admin to be able to fix this matter himself by removing specific watchers on specific issues.
fields.summary: Give the Administrator of the repository the ability to remove watchers by issue (BB-13544)

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

# Create a repository that has both a Wiki and an Issue Tracker.
# Create a long Wiki page that refers to issues using the "issue #XXX" syntax.

*Expected behavior*

The issue links should be parsed and link to the associated issues.

*Actual behavior*

The issue links are not parsed and no links are created.

*Additional information*

The problem appears related to the size of the Wiki page.

* Long wiki page with the problem: https://bitbucket.org/chromiumembedded/cef/wiki/ReleaseNotes
* Short wiki page without the problem: https://bitbucket.org/chromiumembedded/java-cef/wiki/ReleaseNotes
fields.summary: Issue links not parsed for large Wiki pages (BB-12419)

fields.description:
Hi,

when we valid a Pull request with "delete branch" checked. the branch (ie: hotfix/xxxxx) is deleted from the git but still appear on the branch listing on bibucket. A 404 error is reaised when we click on the link.

Is a cron can check this kind of artifact ? or is it a bug on the pull request feature ?

We have to recreate branch , push and delete manually,it is harassing !
fields.summary: Git pull request with branche deletion not working

fields.description:
when  i type the below command i am able to get the changed files between given date and time frame. In the same way , do i have any command which will pull me the files changed between given date and time.....

Command\\
git log --after="2015-02-26 16:00:00" --before="2015-00-00 22:20:20"  --name-only --pretty="format:"
fields.summary: How to pull changed files between given dates?

fields.description:
I have two branches, "master" and "second". I have no subfolder in "master", but in "second", I have a subfolder named "folder1"

In the Source page, when I accessed "folder 1" in "second", it appeared normal:

!2988868869-folder.PNG|thumbnail!

But from that link, I changed to the branch back to "master", it transferred me to a deadlink because I have no "folder1" in "master":

!1160620624-folder2.PNG|thumbnail!

I'm not sure if this is a bug or an intended behavior. But if this is an intended - when we change the branch within a subfolder, maybe we can have an improvement where it will keep us on that page, but popup an error message saying that the subfolder doesn't exist on that branch.
fields.summary: Request: A popup error message instead of deadlink page when changing branch within a subfolder. (BB-12420)

fields.description: My stockme repo got stuck on import. What should I do?
fields.summary: Importing repository stuck.

fields.description:
As a JIRA user that also is an JIRA-integrated SCM user of some sort (Bitbucket in my example), I click the Create Branch link and get put into Bitbucket with an auto-created banch name of:

WEB-950-issue-with-paidfree-reporting-in

...consisting of the Issue Key + a length-limited "Train-Case" part of the Summary, we would like the flexibility to have it just be:

WEB-950

It would be helpful to have a limited "printf" format model where key bits of the issue were available for customization into the branch name.  In our case, we just want the Issue Key.

Prototype: Where these (and other) format strings are possible with built-in definitions:

{code}
#!bash
%s = Summary
%k = Issue Key
%K = Issue Key All Caps
%f = Fix Version
%a = Assignee
{code}

...etc. then the JIRA Administrator would be able to automate the branch name format in a way that makes the Create Branch link more usable and prevents some naming errors.
fields.summary: Custom Formats For Bitbucket-from-JIRA Branch Names (BB-12423)

fields.description:

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Linking+Bitbucket+and+GitHub+accounts+to+JIRA

This page gives incorrect information as to what the GitHub Authorization Callback URL should be:

*Enter the JIRA URL for both the URL and Callback URLfields. Press Register Application.*

The correct authorization callback URL should be

*JIRA_BASE_URL + “/plugins/servlet/oauth/authorize”*\\
as per http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/04/connecting-jira-6-2-github/
fields.summary: Inaccurate information in Documentation: "Linking Bitbucket and GitHub accounts to JIRA"

fields.description:
I am facing problem while pushing with correct credential and its shows authorization failed most of the time. For every push its taking 10-15 tries which is very irritating.\\
Sometimes commit got pushed but console shows an error for authorization failed, I am helpless please help me for this regard
fields.summary: Push having problem of Authorization failed with correct credential. (BB-12392)

fields.description:
Hi, my name is Sam and this is my first time using bitbucket, and I am still dummy yet.

(1) I am a piano teacher, and might have a few project with other music teachers too. So basically we will have a lots audio/video recording and a lots musical work sheet. And my question is do I allow upload mp3, ogg, midi, avi, mp4, and pdf files?? (my own record)

(2) How much maximum mb or files and the storage?

(3) How long inactive account will going suspend/banned?
fields.summary: Some question need to ask...

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/klanguedoc/openpyxl

I am trying to clone the above repo to my windows (8.1) laptop using the\\
git clone https://bitbucket.org/klanguedoc/openpyxl command

However I am getting the following error:

D:\pylibs\pyxls>git clone https://bitbucket.org/klanguedoc/openpyxl\\
Cloning into 'openpyxl'...\\
fatal: repository 'https://bitbucket.org/klanguedoc/openpyxl/' not found
fields.summary: fatal: repository not found

fields.description:
embed.ly is a service that allows content to be embedded in other web sites. I want to embed my public repositories in my LinkedIn profile. embed.ly already supports GitHub.

embed.ly does all the work required to add BitBucket.org to their long list of supported sites. You at BitBucket.org just need to ask, at http://embed.ly/providers/new.

I do not represent embed.ly. I just want to show my public repositories in my LinkedIn profile.

This issue is probably a job for your marketing department.
fields.summary: Please ask embed.ly to support BitBucket.org (BB-13545)
Hi can you remove uanvailable repository https://bitbucket.org/agile-works/nopcommerce

fields.description: It seems that any sort of link to a page archived by archive.org, like {{https://web.archive.org/web/20140327013003/http://jayrock.berlios.de/}}, does not work when encoded in Markdown. It seems that the URL embedded within a URL format used by archive.org is not being recognized as a valid URL and comes out wrong in the formatted HTML.
fields.summary: URL linkifier fails on archive.org URLs (BB-12662)

fields.description: add lisp and picolisp to list of languages of repo.
fields.summary: Add Lisp and PicoLisp to repository language list (BB-12567)
test

fields.summary: fbs files are not rendered correctyl

fields.description:
when I use chinese show my repositories , this is nothing ssh url and http url !!!!

当我使用中文显示bitbucket的时候，我的仓库的下载链接不论是ssh 还是http都是空的（null）
fields.summary: when i use chinese language ,my repositories ssh and http url is null

fields.description: I know this is mostly user error, but if user be erroring, help them use your product better. I'm sure you've been here more than once: You've typed away a long, detailed comment in an issue, when you think, oh, wait, I need to check something in the code. God bless Bitbucket for making navigation so easy, because you've got that side bar and a nice "Source" icon that will take you right to what you're looking for. Once you're done looking at the code, you go back to that comment, so frantically look for that tab where you had typed in all that precious info... only to find that it's now all gone. And it makes you just a little bit sadder that it's going to be that much longer before you get to enjoy the California sunshine.... So please, for the love of God, notify me that I'm navigating away from a page in which I've typed a bunch of text, and ask me if I really want to kill all those bits. Or at least save that text field so that when I frantically hit that back button I can feel some extra love for you guys saving my bacon.
fields.summary: When navigating away from page with unsubmitted text in field, save text or pop-up alert

fields.description: On Internet Explorer 9, trying to access https://bitbucket.org/account/signin/?next=/ to login will  automatically redirects the page to the signup page, making it not possible to log into the site on the browser.
fields.summary: Login page issue on IE 9 (BB-12424)

fields.description:
If a user belonging to our Bitbucket team has admin rights to a repository (but not admin rights to the team itself), they are not able to view our team groups in the menu on the Access Management screen of the repo to which they have admin access on.

It appears that only users who have full team admin are able to see the full listing of groups for a team.

It would be nice if repo admins could at least see the groups in the menu for the purposes of using the groups to grant repository access.  I understand that you wouldn't want to allow a repo admin to modify the groups, but they should be able to *see* them in the menu in order to grant access to that repo.
fields.summary: Team groups are invisible to non-team-admins that have admin on a team repo (BB-12658)

fields.description:
I'm trying to push my existing local hg repository up to a freshly created hg repo on BitBucket, and I get the error:

{{abort: No space left on device}}

The whole project directory is approx. 1.1 GB, however there are many subdirectories with binary data files which are not included (ignored).

Why doesn't BitBucket have enough storage space for my project?
fields.summary: hg push: "abort: No space left on device"

fields.description: Unable to save changes when editing a file using the BitBucket cloud editor. The commit button is missing at the bottom editing area
fields.summary: Unable to save changes when editing a file through bitBucket editor

fields.description:
Hello,

I would like a feature that allows the user to create an independent Wiki and Issue Tracker that is not linked to any project.

For example, I have multiple projects on Bitbucket. However, those projects are all under an umbrella of a larger project. The projects could be

# Android development bucket
# iPhone development bucket
# Website development bucket
# Back end development bucket

All those buckets are different separate projects, however they are all part of the same larger project.

I would like the ability to have on Wiki and one Issue Tracker for all projects (the whole group above), that is not related to one specific project. It makes it easier to have an overall look, and also makes documentations easier.
fields.summary: Independent Wiki and Issue Tracker

fields.description:
The README editing functionality in project site is handy, but it currently uses non-monospaced font, which is a critical issue while editing indentation sensitive text formats.

As seen in screenshot, it seems the markItUpContainer overrides the previous (and valid definition).
fields.summary: Restore the monospace font in README editor (BB-12656)
